info.title: NGINX Controller Application Delivery REST API
info.description: Use the NGINX Controller Application Delivery module to configure, secure, monitor, and troubleshoot load balancing for your applications.

tags.name: Instances
tags.description: Use the Instance API to manage NGINX Controller Instance resources.

tags.name: Instance Groups
tags.description: Use the Instance Groups API to manage a set of instances that can be used for scaling and high availability. The Instance Groups API is a beta feature and is not recommended for use in production environments.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Use the Environments API to manage your Application Environments.

tags.name: Certs
tags.description: Use the Certs API to manage the certificates used to secure your App traffic.

tags.name: Gateways
tags.description: Use the Gateways API to manage Gateway resources.

tags.name: API Definitions
tags.description: Use the API Definitions API to manage your APIs by using the NGINX Controller API Management module.

tags.name: DevPortals
tags.description: Use the DevPortals API to manage DevPortals resources.

tags.name: Identity Providers
tags.description: Use the Identity Provider API to manage Identity providers in the API-M Credential Management partition.

tags.name: Published APIs
tags.description: Use the Published APIs API to manage your APIs by using the API Management module.

tags.name: Error Sets
tags.description: Use the Error Sets API to view the default predefined Error Sets.

tags.name: Services
tags.description:
Use the Services API to request a metadata list of a desired resource within a single environment or across all environments.
Currently supported resources include:
  - published-apis

get.summary: List all Instances in a Location
get.description: Returns the status and metadata for all of the Instances in the specified Location.

200.description: Successfully returned the status and metadata for all of the Instances in the specified Location.

202.description: The Instance resource has been accepted for creation. The Instance will be created after it is done configuring.

400.description: Bad input parameter or URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

example.message: Error creating the instance: could not parse the request payload. Check the format of the request, then try again.

409.description: The request failed due to a conflict with an existing Instance resource.

example.message: Error creating the instance: the instance already exists. Use a unique name for the instance, then try again.

get.description: Returns the status and metadata for a single Instance.

200.description: Successfully returned the details for an Instance.

404.description: Instance not found.

example.message: Error getting the instance: the specified instance does not exist. Check the instance name, then try again.

put.description: Updates the description or display name of an existing Instance.

200.description: Successfully updated the existing Instance.

400.description: Bad input parameter or URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

example.message: Error updating the instance: could not parse the request payload. Check the format of the request, then try again.

404.description: Instance not found.

example.message: Error updating the instance: the specified instance does not exist. Check the instance name, then try again.

202.description: Request for delete accepted

204.description: Successfully deleted the Instance. No content is returned.

404.description: Instance not found.

example.message: Error deleting the instance: the specified instance does not exist. Check the instance name, then try again.

409.description:
Failed to delete the requested Instance resource.

The Instance is referenced by another resource. Remove the references to the Instance, then try again.

example.message: Error deleting the instance: the NGINX instance is being configured. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact the system administrator.

get.description: Returns an unfiltered list of all Instance Group resources.

200.description: Successfully retieved a list of all the configured Instance Groups.

post.description: Creates an new Instance Group resource.

requestBody.description: Defines the Instance Group resource to be added.

202.description: The Instance Group resource has been accepted for creation. The Instance Group will be created after it is done configuring.

get.description: Returns information about a specified Instance Groupe resource.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the requested Instance Group resource.

put.description: Creates a new Instance Group resource or updates an existing Instance Group resource.

202.description: The Instance Group resource has been accepted for creation or update.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Instance Group resource.

204.description: Successfully deleted the specified Instance Group resource.

get.description: Returns a list of all Environment resources.

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of all Environment resources.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

requestBody.description: Defines the Environment resource to create.

202.description: The Environment resource has been accepted for creation. The Environment will be created after it is done configuring.

409.description: The request failed due to a naming conflict with an existing resource.

200.description: Successfully returned information for the specified Environment resource.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

404.description: The resource defined in the URI could not be found. Check the URI for errors and try again.

put.description: Creates a new Environment or updates an existing Environment resource.

requestBody.description: Defines the Environment to create or the updates to make to an existing Environment.

200.description: Successfully updated the specified Environment resource.

201.description: Successfully created the specified Environment resource.

202.description: The Environment resource has been accepted for creation or update. The Environment will be created or updated after it is done configuring.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

404.description: The resource defined in the URI could not be found. Check the URI for errors and try again.

202.description: The Environment resource has been marked for deletion. The Environment will be deleted after the underlying resources have been deleted.

204.description: Successfully deleted the specified Environment resource. No content returned.

404.description: The resource defined in the URI could not be found. Check the URI for errors and try again.

409.description:
Failed to delete the requested Environment resource.

The Environment contains references to other objects. Delete the referenced objects or remove the references, then try again.

The request to delete the specified Cert resource failed.
The Cert is referenced by active objects and cannot be deleted. Delete the referencing objects or remove the references, then try again.

The request to create a Gateway resource failed due to exceeding request processing threshold.

get.summary: List the metadata for all instances of the desired resource.
get.description: Returns a metadata list of the requested resource. The resources that can be queried is currently restricted to published-apis.

200.description: Successfully retrieved a metadata list of the requested resource.

400.description: The resource defined in the query parameters could not be found or is not yet supported. Check the input for typos and try again.

404.description: The environment defined in the query parameters could not be found.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Filter desired resource based on the environment.

get.description: Returns a list of API Definition resources.

200.description: Successfully retrieved a list of all API Definitions.

404.description: The specified API Definition resource was not found or does not contain any Versions.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

204.description: Successfully deleted the Versions for the requested API Definition resource. No content is returned.

404.description: The specified API Definition resource was not found or does not contain any Versions.

409.description: Failed to delete the Versions for the specified API Definition resource. Delete or remove any references to Published APIs, then try again.

404.description: The specified API Definition Version resource was not found.

204.description: Successfully deleted the API Definition Version resource.

404.description: The specified API Definition Version resource was not found.

409.description: Failed to delete the specified API Definition resource. Delete or remove any references to Published APIs, then try again.

put.description:
Imports an API spec to the specified Version of an API Definition.

Use this endpoint to import a raw API specification to define your API.

- This endpoint accepts a valid OpenAPI 3 spec, formatted as valid JSON or YAML.
- The file provided for import will be validated against the
  [OAS v3 schema](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/schemas/v3.0/schema.yaml).
- You must specify a "Content-Type" header when importing an API spec.
  The endpoint accepts the following "Content-Type" values:

  - application/json
  - application/yaml
  - text/x-yaml
  - application/x-yaml
  - text/yaml

200.description: Successfully completed the API Version Import request.

201.description: Successfully created the requested API Definition Version resource from the spec provided.

400.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

415.description: The request body contains an unsupported content type.

get.description:
Returns a list of all Identity Provider resources.

Gateway.description:
A Gateway represents the initial network entry point of application and/or API traffic into an NGINX instance that is
in the data path of this traffic. Gateway settings are combined with Component settings that reference the Gateway;
the resulting composite config is sent to the NGINX instances that the Gateway references.

A Gateway can be referenced by either web components and/or TCP/UDP components. Web-only settings in the Gateway (for example, web URIs)
apply only to web components. TCP/UDP-only settings in the Gateway (for example, TCP/UDP URIs) apply only to TCP/UDP components.
Web and TCP/UDP common settings in the Gateway (for example, global TLS, socket) apply to both web and TCP/UDP components.

Examples:
Gateway with web and TCP/UDP URIs, web-specific settings, common settings. Web URIs and web settings apply to web components.
Common settings apply to both component types. TCP/UDP URIs apply only to TCP/UDP components –- presently, there are no other TCP/UDP only settings.

Gateway web URIs (for example, https://www.xyz.com) combined with web component URIs (for example, /blog) define web URI config (https://www.xyz.com/blog).
Component TCP/UDP URIs define TCP/UDP URI config (for example, tcp+tls://192.168.1.1:200); Gateway TCP/UDP URIs can provide TLS info plus restrict
which TCP/UDP URIs can be in the component. Alternatively, component URIs fully define the URI config if the Gateway has no URIs.

If only a single URI type is in the Gateway, the URI config for that type is determined by combining the Gateway URIs with
the URIs from components of that type; only component URIs are used for the URI config for the other type.

For HTTPS URIs, global Gateway TLS settings are used when more specific TLS info is not present in the Gateway URIs,
or for component URIs that have an HTTPS protocol and hostnames with no specific URI or component global TLS settings defined.

For tcp+tls URIs, Gateway TLS settings are used when TLS info is not defined in a component URI or component global TLS.
A Gateway URI’s TLS info is used if it encompasses the component URI. For example, tcp+tls://192.168.1.5:100-104 in the Gateway and
component URI of tcp+tls://192.168.1.5:100. Global Gateway TLS is used if no other TLS settings apply.

GatewayWebState.description: Non-ingress settings in a Gateway that apply only to Web Components.

directive.description: The name of the NGINX directive. For a list of NGINX Directives, refer to [the NGINX documentation](http://nginx.org/en/docs/dirindex.html).

block.description: The directives to include within a block directive or context.

directives.description: List of NGINX directives to add to the configuration.

URIMatchMethod.description: Specifies how to determine a match between an incoming Web URI and configured Web URI.

ApplicableUris.description:
Defines an array of ingress URIs with a corresponding matchMethod that this rule/snippet applies to.
By default, a rule/snippet applies to all ingress URIs in the gateway/component. A snippet can be
applied only to URIs of the gateway/component that it is in. A snippet in a component cannot be
applied to the gateway URI. However, a rule can be applied at a gateway level by specifying ingress
URIs from the gateway, for example, "http://www.nginx.com". Note that applying the rule to URIs at
a gateway level can affect other components. The URI and the matchMethod must match an ingress URI defined
either at the component or gateway level. If no match is found, the request is rejected.

UriSnippet.description:
The NGINX directives to apply to the server and location blocks generated by the URIs.
Directives are applied to all URIs by default. Use applicableURIs to apply directives
only to specific URIs.

GatewayConfigSnippets.description:
The NGINX config snippets to insert into the NGINX config generated by the gateway.
Note that the default directives and directives generated by the native parts of the
API(API sections other than configSnippets) cannot be overriden.
mainSnippet - Insert directives in the main context.
httpSnippet - Insert directives in the http context.
streamSnippet - Insert directives in the stream context.
uriSnippet - Insert into server blocks generated by the gateway URIs.
  This applies only to HTTP URIs, since TCP and UDP URIs do not
  generate server blocks.

**Caution**: When you use snippets to customize your NGINX configuration, your changes are
applied to the nginx.conf file *as is*. NGINX Controller does not verify that your configuration
is valid before applying the snippet.

We strongly recommend verifying snippets in a lab environment before making any changes
in production.

isEnabled.description:
Enables or disables HA.

When set to `true`, supports configuring instances in an active‑passive, high‑availability (HA) setup.

To configure the gateway on HA mode:
  - `keepalived` must be installed and configured on the desired instances.
  - At least one listen IP address must be specified in the `listenIps` section within `InstanceRefs`

  See the `listenIps` section for additional requirements for configuring HA.

GatewayStateCommon.description: Non-ingress settings in a Gateway that apply to Web and TCP/UDP Components.

serverPoolPort.description: The port number used when the IngressUri is deployed to an Instance that's a member of a BIG-IP server pool.

IngressUris.description:
Defines the URI in Gateways and Components. The URI has different requirements depending on where it is used.

For Web URIs in Gateways, `uris` must be a complete URI that follows the format `<http|https>://host[:port]`;
additionally each URI can have a match method specified and an HTTPS URI can include TLS information.
  Examples:
  - `http://www.f5.com`
  - `https://www.f5.com`
  - `http://www.f5.com:8080`
  - `http://*.info.f5.com`

For Web URIs in Components, `uris` can be either a complete URI that follows the format `<http|https>://host[:port][/path]`
or a relative path that follows the format `/path[/...]`;
additionally each URI can have a match method specified and an HTTPS URI can include TLS information.
  Examples:
  - `/images`
  - `/*.jpg`
  - `/locations/us/wa*`
  - `http://www.f5.com:8080/sales`
  - `http://*.f5.com:5050/testing`

For TCP/UDP URIs in Gateways and Components,`uris` must be a complete URI that follows the format `<tcp|udp|tcp+tls>://<*|IP>:<port|portRange>`;
additionally a tcp+tls URI can include TLS information. Match method is not applicable to TCP/UDP URIs.
  Examples:
  - `tcp://192.168.1.1:12345`
  - `tcp+tls://192.168.1.1:12346`
  - `tcp://192.168.1.1:12345-12350`
  - `tcp://*:12345`
  - `udp://192.168.1.1:12345`
  - `udp://*:12345`

In a TCP/UDP Component, URIs can either all have a protocol of udp or a mix of TCP and tcp+tls.

additionalProperties.description: Provide the URI associated with the resource.

listenIps.description:
The list of Listen IP addresses.
Sets the BIG-IP virtual address(es) on which the server listens for and accepts requests.

Placement.description: Instances that have NGINX configuration applied corresponding to the Gateway and associated Components settings.

GatewayIngressCommon.description: Ingress settings in a Gateway that apply to Web and TCP/UDP Components.

WebIngressCommon.description: Ingress settings in a Gateway and Component that apply only to Web Components.

methods.description: Specifies the HTTP method to use in requests.

clientMaxBodySize.description: Sets the maximum allowed size of the client request body, specified in the “Content-Length” request header field.

headers.description: Specifies the match method for headers to be used in requests.

http2.description:
Enable or disable HTTP/2 connections on the port. Normally, for this to work the `ssl` parameter should be specified as well,
but NGINX can also be configured to accept HTTP/2 connections without SSL.
Possible values are `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

spdy.description:
Enables or disables acceptance of the SPDY connections on the specified port.
Normally, for this to work the `ssl` parameter should be specified as well,
but NGINX can also be configured to accept SPDY connections without SSL. Possible values are `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

proxyProtocol.description:
Enables or disables the proxy protocol for all connections accepted on the specified port.
The `proxy protocol` enables NGINX and NGINX Plus to receive client connection information passed through proxy servers and load balancers,
such as HAproxy and Amazon Elastic Load Balancer (ELB). The possible values are `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

headersHashBucketSize.description: Sets the bucket size for hash tables used by the `proxy_hide_header` and `proxy_set_header` directives.

headersHashMaxSize.description: Sets the maximum size of hash tables used by the `proxy_hide_header` and `proxy_set_header` directives.

GatewayWebIngressClient.description: Non-buffer settings in a Gateway applicable to Web client requests.

bodyInFileOnly.description: Determines whether NGINX Controller should save the entire client request body into a file.

bodyTimeout.description: Defines a timeout for reading the client request body.

headerTimeout.description: Defines a timeout for reading the client request header.

maxBodySize.description:
Sets the maximum allowed size of the client request body, specified in the “Content-Length” request header field.

Disables checking of client request body size when set to 0.

WebIngressBuffersCommon.description: Buffer settings common to a Gateway and Component applicable to web client requests.

clientBodyBufferingIsEnabled.description: Enables or disables buffering of a client request body.

clientBodyBufferSize.description: Sets the buffer size for reading the client request body.

clientBodyInSingleBuffer.description: Determines whether NGINX Controller should save the entire client request body in a single buffer.

GatewayWebIngress.description: Ingress settings in a Gateway that apply only to Web Components.

allowUnderscoresInHeaders.description:
Allows the use of underscores in client request header fields.

When set to `disabled`, request headers with names that contain underscores are considered invalid and are ignored.

clientHeaderBufferSize.description: Sets the buffer size for reading the client request header.

GatewayDesiredState.description: The desired gateway settings that the user wants in the configuration on NGINX instances referenced by this Gateway.

authorityKeyIdentifier.description: The identifier of the signing authority for the certificate.

commonName.description: The Common Name (CN) for the certificate. This is typically a Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN), and must be the same as the web address users access when connecting to a web site.

expired.description: Indicates the expiration status of the certificate.

expiry.description: The number of seconds until the certificate will expire.

issuer.example: DigiCert Class 3 Extended Validation SSL SGC CA.
issuer.description: Identifies the entity who signed and issued the certificate.

publicKeyType.description: Identifies the encryption algorithm used to create the public key for the ceritficate.

serialNumber.description: A unique identifier for the certificate.

signatureAlgorithm.description: Identifies the algorithm used to sign the certificate.

subject.description: Contains the Distinguished Name (DN) information for the certificate.

subjectAlternativeName.description: Defines additional identifies bound to the subject of the certificate. For example, the DNS name is used to add addtional domain names to a certificate.

subjectKeyIdentifier.example: 31 EA 76 A9 23 74 A5 DF D4 FD EE A0 C1 A6 9E C6 11 0E 11 EC
subjectKeyIdentifier.description: A hash value of the SSL certificate that can be used to identify certificates that contain a particular public key.

thumbprint.description: A hash to ensure that the certificate has not been modified.

thumbprintAlgorithm.description: Defines the algorithm used to hash the certificate.

validFrom.description: The start of the validity period for the certificate.

validTo.description: The end of the validity period for the certificate.

version.description: The version of the certificate, typically 3 for X.509 certificates.

CertCurrentStatus.description:
'Shows the current status of the certificate.

When any certificates have expired, the Certs service sets `state.selfConfigState.isConfigured` and `state.selfConfigState.isError` to `true`. The service will also add a value to the conditons array with the type "expiration" and a message that shows when the first certificate will expire. For example, `conditions: [{type: "expiration", message: "Certificate www.example.com will expire in 29 days."}])`'

PEM.description:
Defines a PEM-formatted certificate that contains a key and certificates.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).
The private key data will be redacted in the response for all get and list requests.

password.description: The passphrase to use to decrypt the private key. Required if the private key is encrypted.

privateKey.description:
The private key used to sign the public certificate.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`). The private key data will be redacted in the response for all get and list requests.

publicCert.description:
The end-entity certificate, in PEM format.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).

caCerts.description:
An optional list of intermediate certificates in PEM format that are used to validate the public certificate.

Because JSON does not support multi-line strings, you must replace binary line feeds with ASCII line feeds (`\n`).

PKCS12.description: Defines a cert with key and certificates encoded in PKCS12 format.

data.description: A base-64-encoded string that contains a private key, a public certificate, and, optionally, other intermediate certificates.

password.description: The password to use to decrypt PKCS12 data.

RemoteFile.description:
Define a Cert resource by providing references to remote files.

> **Note:** These are file path references only. The system can not validate the file contents or extract the certificate metadata. Providing a PEM or PKCS12 certificate is recommended.

privateKey.description: The path to the private key file.

publicCert.description: The path to the certificate bundle file. The file must contain the public certificate and may contain additional intermediate certificates.

IdentityProviderList.description: Contains a list of Identity Provider resources.

APIKeyIdentityProvider.description:
Use an API key for authentication.

> **Note:** Use of API Key authN is not recommended in production environments.

jwkFile.description:
Provide the path to - or URI for - a `.jwk` file to use for authentication.
You can also provide the `.jwk` file contents inline.

environmentRefs.description: The Enviroment associated with the Identity Provider.

IdentityProviderData.description: The means of authentication used by the Identity Provider (JWT or APIKey).

kty.description: The cryptographic algorithm family used with the key, such as "RSA" or "EC".

use.description: The intended use of the public key, whether for encrypting data or verifying the signature on data.

key_ops.description: The operation(s) for which the key is intended to be used.

alg.description: The algorithm intended for use with the key.

kid.description: The key ID used to match a specific key.

x5u.description: The X.509 URL that refers to a resource for an X.509 public key certificate or certificate chain.

x5c.description: The X.509 Certificate Chain of one or more PKIX certificates. The PKIX certificate containing the key value MUST be the first certificate.

x5t.description: The X.509 Certificate SHA-1 Thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of an X.509 certificate.

x5t256.description: The X.509 Certificate SHA-256 Thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of an X.509 certificate.

p2s.description: The salt input value  for PBES2 key encryption, which is used as part of the PBKDF2 salt value.

p2c.description: The PBKDF2 iteration count for PBES2 key encryption, represented as a positive JSON integer. The iteration count adds computational expense, ideally compounded by the possible range of keys introduced by the salt.  A minimum iteration count of 1000 is RECOMMENDED.

crv.description: The cryptographic curve used for an Elliptic Curve public key.

x.description: The x coordinate of the point for an Elliptic Curve public key.

y.description: The y coordinate of the point for an Elliptic Curve public key.

e.description: The exponent value for an RSA public key.

exp.description: The exponent value for an RSA public key.

n.description: The modulus value for an RSA public key.

mod.description: The modulus value for an RSA public key.

d.description: The private key value for an Elliptic Curve private key OR the private exponent value for an RSA private key.

p.description: The first prime factor for an RSA private key.

q.description: The second prime factor for an RSA private key.

dp.description: The Chinese Remainder Theorem (CRT) exponent of the first factor for an RSA private key.

dq.description: The CRT exponent of the second factor for an RSA private key.

qi.description: The CRT coefficient of the second factor for an RSA private key.

oth.description: An array of information about any third and subsequent primes, should they exist.

d.description: The factor CRT exponent of the corresponding prime factor.

t.description: The factor CRT coefficient of the corresponding prime factor.

iv.description: The base64url-encoded representation of the 96-bit Initialization Vector value used for the AES GCM key encryption operation.

tag.description: The base64url-encoded representation of the 128-bit Authentication Tag value resulting from the AES GCM key encryption operation.

k.description: The key value of the symmetric (or other single-valued) key.

epk.description: The ephemeral public key value created by the originator for use in ECDH-ES key agreement algorithms.

apu.description: The agreement PartyUInfo for ECDH-ES key agreement algorithms, containing information about the producer.

apv.description: The agreement PartyVInfo for ECDH-ES key agreement algorithms.

JWKInline.description: Inline contents of a JWK JSON file.

cacheExpire.description:
The length of time for which to cache the remote file.
NGINX will retrieve the file from the source URI when the cache time expires.

apiKey.description:
If left empty, a key will automatically be generated.
The apikey must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and hyphens.
The length of the apikey must be between 8 - 256 characters.

locationRef.description: Reference to location all instances of the group belong to.  If not specified, the default 'unspecified' is assumed.
Reference to location all instances of the group belong to.  If not specified, the default 'unspecified' is assumed.

InstanceRef.description: Reference to a member Instance resource.

integrationRef.description: Reference to a BIG-IP Integration object, indicating that the Instances will be members of a BIG-IP server pool.

serverPoolIp.description:
The Instance IP addresses or CIDR to use when the Instance is a member of a BIG-IP server pool.
If this is a CIDR, then the Instance IP address that matches the mask will be the member address in the BIG-IP server pool.
Otherwise, absolute IP addresses will be used as server-pool member addresses.

gatewayRefs.description: Reference to the Gateways that act as a Developer Portal.
Reference to the Gateways that act as a Developer Portal.

publishedTime.description:
Published time is a timestamp that represents the server time when the resource was published.
Resources that have never been published do not have an `published_time` stamp.
The default value is language-specific and, in general, should be equivalent of the null construct.
In JSON format, `published_time` type is encoded as a string as described in [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

For example: 2018-04-01T01:30:15.01Z

DevPortalTheme.description: Specifies the theming for the Developer Portal.

overrideDefaultTheme.description: Override the default Dev Portal theme with a custom theme.

primary.description: A CSS color string used as a primary brand theme color.

accent.description: A CSS color string used as an optional second brand theme color.

gray.description: A CSS color string used to generate a grayscale color palette.

link.description: A CSS color string used to generate anchor link colors.

fill.description: A CSS color string used as the main background color.

ink.description: A CSS color string used as the main text color.

ThemeConfigStatusColors.description: A collection of CSS color strings used to indicate status.

info.description: A CSS color string used to indicate an informational status.

success.description: A CSS color string used to indicate a success status.

error.description: A CSS color string used to indicate an error status.

warning.description: A CSS color string used to indicate a warning status.

ThemeConfigFonts.description: A collection of fonts for theming typography.

body.description: A font used for body copy.

cta.description: A font used for calls to action.

code.description: A font used for code and syntax highlighting.

special.description: A font used for special accent typography.

FileEncodedString.description: Base64 encoded string of a logo.

Environment.description: An Environment is a logical container that you can use to organize your Apps. A few commonly-used examples of Environments are "dev" and "production".

RESTAPISpec.description: Validates an Imported OpenAPI 3 spec formatted as JSON using the [OAS v3 schema.yaml](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/schemas/v3.0/schema.yaml) specification.

ref.description: Reference to the Version of the API Definition.

type.description: OTHER_INSTANCE is an Instance pre-installed and self-registered during NGINX installation.
AWS_INSTANCE is an Instance hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS).
AZURE_INSTANCE is an Instance hosted in Microsoft Azure.
An Instance that resides on a VSphere host.

OtherInstanceCurrentStatus.description: Contains the current status of the Other Instance.

version.description: The version of NGINX running on the Instance.

muted.description:
Indicates the status of notifications and alerts.
- 'True' means that notifications and alerts are muted.
- 'False' means that notifications and alerts are active.

type.description: OTHER_INSTANCE is an Instance pre-installed and self-registered during NGINX installation.

AWSInstanceCurrentStatus.description: Contains the current status of the AWS Instance.

version.description: The version of NGINX running on the Instance.

muted.description:
Indicates the status of notifications and alerts.
- 'True' means that notifications and alerts are muted.
- 'False' means that notifications and alerts are active.

type.description: AWS_INSTANCE is an Instance hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS).

AzureInstanceCurrentStatus.description: Contains the current status of the Azure Instance.

version.description: The version of NGINX running on the Instance.

muted.description:
Indicates the mute status of notifications and alerts.
- 'True' means that notifications and alerts are muted.
- 'False' means that notifications and alerts are active.

type.description: AZURE_INSTANCE is an Instance hosted in Microsoft Azure.

VSphereInstanceCurrentStatus.description: Reflects the current status of the VSphere Instance.

type.description:
An Instance that resides on a VSphere host.
VSPHERE_INSTANCE is an Instance hosted in VSphere.

version.description: The version of NGINX running on the Instance.

TemplateRef.description: Reference to an existing Instance Template resource. This field cannot be updated.

LegacySystemMetadata.description:
Metadata that describe the operating system attributes and properties of an Instance host system.  It is
intended for internal use only and is subject to change.

LegacyNginxMetadata.description:
Metadata that describe an Instance's NGINX process configuration and properties.  It is intended
for internal use only and is subject to change.

Agent.description: The properties of the Controller Agent running on the Instance

version.description: The version of Controller Agent that is currently running on the Instance.

online.description: The status of Controller Agent that is currently running on the Instance.

AgentCredentials.description: The credentials of the Controller Agent running on the Instance.

OtherNetworkConfig.description: The network config of a customer deployed Instance.

OtherNetworkInterface.description: A network interface for a customer deployed Instance.

name.description: The name of the network interface attached to the Instance.

privateDnsName.description: The private, internal hostname of the instance, which resolves to the Instance's private IP address.

privateIP.description: The private IP address of the network interface.

privateIPv6.description: The private IPv6 address of the network interface.

subnet.description: The subnet that contains the interface.

cidrIPv4.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the subnet.

cidrIPv6.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the subnet.

AWSNetworkConfig.description: The network config of an AWS Instance.

AWSNetworkInterface.description: A network interface for an AWS Instance.

name.description: The name of the network interface attached to the Instance.

privateDnsName.description: The private, internal hostname of the instance, which resolves to the Instance's private IP address.

publicDnsName.description: The public hostname of the instance, which resolves to the public IP address of the Instance.

privateIP.description: The private IP address of the network interface.

publicIP.description: The public IP address of the network interface.

subnet.description: The subnet that contains the interface.

subnetID.description: The ID of the subnet into which the instance was launched.

cidrIPv4.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the subnet.

cidrIPv6.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the subnet.

AzureNetworkConfig.description: The network config of an Azure Instance.

AzureNetworkInterface.description: A network interface associated with an Azure Instance.

name.description: The name of the network interface attached to the Instance.

publicDnsName.description: The public hostname of the instance, which resolves to the public IP address of the Instance.

privateIP.description: The private IP address of the network interface.

publicIP.description: The public IP address of the network interface.

privateIPv6.description: The private IPv6 address of the network interface.

publicIPv6.description: The public IPv6 address of the network interface.

subnet.description: The subnet that contains the interface.

subnetID.description: The ID of the subnet that contains the Instance.

cidrIPv4.description: The IPv4 CIDR for the subnet.

cidrIPv6.description: The IPv6 CIDR for the subnet.

Nginx.description: Defines properties and configuration values for Nginx.

NginxProcess.description: Defines configuration directives that are defined in the main configuration context.

user.description: Defines user credentials used by worker processes.

group.description:
Defines group credentials used by worker processes.  This will be ignored if the user
property is not defined.

Performance.description: Defines performance tuning directives that are defined in the main configuration context.

workerProcesses.description:
Defines the number of worker processes. To set it to the number of available CPU cores
for a system, use 0.

workerPriority.description:
Defines the scheduling priority for worker processes like it is done by the nice command:
a negative number means higher priority. Allowed range normally varies from -20 to 20.

workerConnections.description:
Sets the maximum number of simultaneous connections that can be opened by a worker process.
This number includes all the connections like proxied servers, connection with clients.

workerRlimitNofile.description:
Sets the limit on the maximum number of open files for worker processes.
Used to increase the limit without restarting the main process.

multiAccept.description:
Sets if the worker process will allow more than one connection at a time. If multiAccept is disabled,
worker process only accepts one connection at a time.

SelfLinks.description:
The SelfLinks object contains a link from the resource to itself.
This object is used only in responses.

rel.description:
`rel` contains the complete path fragment of a URI and can be used
to construct a query to the object.

displayName.description:
`displayName` is a user friendly resource name. It can be used to define 
a longer, and less constrained, name for a resource.

Display names:

- are optional (defaults to an empty string if no value is provided),
- do not have to be unique, 
- cannot be assigned by the server.

description.example: This is a sample description string. It provides information about the resource.
description.description:
`description` is a free-form text property. You can use it to provide information that helps 
to identify the resource.

Descriptions:

- are optional (defaults to an empty string if no value is provided),
- do not have to be unique, 
- cannot be assigned by the server.

kind.description:
Kind is a string representation of an API resource's data type.
It is assigned by the server and cannot be changed. 

When creating a `kind`, the server uses hyphens to connect word segments; 
singleton and collection item resources are not pluralized.

uid.description:
Unique Identifier (UID)

UID is a unique identifier in time and space for a resource. 
When you create a resource, the server assigns a UID to the resource.

Refer to [IETF RFC 4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) for more information.

tags.description:
You can assign `tags` to a resource as a way to help map, scope, 
and organize resources. 

The system uses tag selectors to specify selection criteria that 
match resources that have particular tags.

ref.description: The `ref` field contains a reference to another NGINX Controller resource.

createTime.description:
A timestamp that represents the server time when the resource was created.

Create time is not guaranteed to be set in "happens-before" order
across separate operations.

In JSON format, `create_time` type is encoded as a string in the
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

For example: 2018-04-01T01:30:15.01Z

Create Time is assigned by the server and cannot be changed.

updateTime.description:
A timestamp that represents the server time when the resource was last modified.

Resources that have never been updated do not have an `update_time` stamp.

The default value for resources that have never been updated is the local 
language-specific equivalent of "null".

In JSON format, `update_time` type is encoded as a string as described in 
[RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

isConfiguring.description: The configuration of the resource, or of its child(ren), is in process.

isError.description: An error occurred while configuring the resource or its child(ren).

isDeleting.description: A delete operation is in progress for the resource or its child(ren).

total.description: The total number of resources to which the configuration operation applies.

configured.description: The number of resources that have a complete and valid configuration.

configuring.description: The number of resources that are in the process of being configured.

error.description: The number of resources that have encountered an error during the configuration process.

deleting.description: The number of resources that are in the process of being deleted.

message.description: A human-readable message that provides additional information about the configuration operation.

ConfigState.description:
A representation of the resource's current configuration state 
that comprises the status of the resource itself (`selfConfigState`) and any child 
resources (`childrenConfigState`).

The conditions array provides additional information during configuration changes.

allOf.description:
Contains information about the object being referred to.

These are generally details -- like the object name and display name --
that are useful to a consumer of the API that performs further
processing. 

This object is only present in responses.

name.description: The name of the linked resource.

ref.description: A reference to another NGINX Controller resource.

description.example: Error doing <action>: <reason for error>. This can lead to <potential consequences>. Try <action> to resolve the issue.
description.description:
A detailed error message returned by the server. 

These messages contain the following information, where applicable:

- What happened.
- Why it happened.
- What the consequences are (if any).
- Recommended action to take to resolve the issue.

message.description: A human-readable message, in English, that describes the error.

code.description: A numeric error code that can be used to identify errors for support purposes.

ErrorSet.description: Defines the set of error messages to be returned for HTTP errors.

apiDefinitionVersionRef.description: Reference to the Version of the API Definition.

gatewayRefs.description: Reference to the Gateway associated with the Published API.

devportalRefs.description: Reference to the Dev Portal associated with the Published API.

gatewayRefs.description: Reference to the Gateway associated with the Published API.

devportalRefs.description: Reference to the Dev Portal associated with the Published API.

BadRequest.description: Bad input parameter, or possibly a bad URI. Check the input for typos and try again.

Unauthorized.description: User authentication is invalid or missing.

NotFound.description: The specified instance group resource was not found.

Conflict.description: The request failed due to a conflict with an existing instance group resource.
